Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a draconian attempt to quash free speech.
It is considered the worst piece of legislation for free speech and will have a chilling effect on important debates.
The government should not have the power to define misinformation or disinformation.
The legislation is an overreach of government power and a threat to freedom of speech.
There is no clear definition of 'serious harm,' which is a trigger for action in the legislation.
The legislation exempts state and federal governments, allowing them to spread misinformation without consequence.
Notable Quotes: This is the '…worst piece of legislation for free speech' and will certainly have a '…chilling effect on very important debates'.
How can we trust any government to define for us what misinformation or disinformation is?
The biggest imposition on free speech ever seen in a piece of legislation.
